definition: to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: The TVC is based on the girl's notes and jottings about her travels.
sentences.chinese: 电视广告是一个女孩的旅行摘记。

sentences.english: A comment is a private note for staff not visible to the requestor.
sentences.chinese: 注释是一个对请求者不可见的给员工的隐秘的摘记。

sentences.english: this passage is taken from wuthering heights.
sentences.chinese: 这一段摘记自《呼啸别墅》。

sentences.english: Write out all of the notes that you need to remember over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 写出全部的摘记，你必须一遍又一遍地记住它们。

definition: to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
the palest ink is better than the best memory (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 ji4 xing4 bu4 ru2 lan4 bi3 tou2

definition: headnotes/comments or footnotes at top of the page
